divs: sighting detailsi was lying on my back in my backyard with sunglasses on. it was partly cloudy. i was looking directly up in the sky and i noticed a round object moving slowly from south to north. it was a glowing red sphere approx 1\8" between my thumb and forefinger. it moved, slowed briefly, paused, began moving again and then disappeared. i continued looking in the sky and it reppeared about 10 seconds later, however it had changed its direction completely moving from east to west. it was still glowing a bright red and may have been pulsing. as it moved it turned a brilliant white and then disappeared after a couple of seconds. if it were on land you could say it was traveling about 1-2 miles per hour. at first, i thought it might be a balloon because it was spherical in shape and moved kind of lazily across the sky. i changed my mind the second time i saw it when it took a path totally perpendicular to its original path. also, the second time i saw it it turned to a bright white, which i decided a balloon couldn't manage. i called to my father-in-law who was inside the house to come out and look. we both looked up in the sky for about 10 more minutes, but never saw it again.
Object Flight Path: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
Summary: Glowing red sphere moving slowly in the sky, disappearing and changing direction
